alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 2:27PM MST until August 01 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY NEAR PRESCOTT... At 223 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along Granite Creek near Prescott. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. River gauges have indicated rises above flood stage along Granite Creek. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Oak Knoll Village, Ponderosa Park, White Spar Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 292 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 304 and 315. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Granite Creek, Skull Valley Wash, Lynx Creek, Spence Creek, Miller Creek, Copper Basin Wash, Wolf Creek, Butte Creek, Mint Wash, Bannon Creek, Iron Springs Wash, Hassayampa River and Willow Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
